title: Is our universe a series of completely random events? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a theory for everything in this universe and everything is connected, scientifically. Now if we can explain anything and everything correctly, nothing is going to seem random, don’t you think? The only thing that allows random events in universe possible, for a human mind, is not knowing anything about it and all we can do is predict. False knowledge is misleading too. Looking at the size of the universe, there are so many hidden and mysterious events and phenomenon which we still can’t explain because of constraints like earth’s science itself. On Earth we have explanation for everything but nothing definite about starting of universe i.e. big bang and it’s possible ending like big rip, big freeze or big crunch. If we find out the starting point and ending point of our universe, it will all be a series of chronological events, universe won’t be a series of complete random events after then.
